item.title: 5 Bitcoin and Blockchain Startups to Watch in 2016 - CoinDesk
item.description:
5 Bitcoin and Blockchain Startups to Watch in 2016 - CoinDesk

Jad Mubaslat is the founder and CEO of BitQuick.co, the Ohio State Bitcoin Group, a former graduate of Boost VC and a bitcoin user since 2011. BitQuick.co is a P2P marketplace that allows individuals to buy and sell bitcoins in the US via cash deposit.

item.title: 14 Headlines That Rocked Bitcoin and the Blockchain in 2015 - CoinDesk
item.description:
14 Headlines That Rocked Bitcoin and the Blockchain in 2015 - CoinDesk

It's been another formative year in the world of bitcoin and the blockchain, and while the price has been subdued over much of the year, other developments in the space have arguably been more intriguing than in any 12-month period previously.

item.title: Bitcoin's Big Challenge in 2016: Reaching 100 Million Users
item.description:
Bitcoin's Big Challenge in 2016: Reaching 100 Million Users

Michael Jackson is the former COO of Skype, a current venture capital investor at Mangrove Capital Partners and a board member at bitcoin wallet provider Blockchain. Here he explores the importance of creating bitcoin products and services that will delight users globally and prove the technology's worth in 2016.

item.title: Why did Bitcoin just jump in price (early June 2016)?
item.description:
Why did Bitcoin just jump in price (early June 2016)?

Answer: Bitcoin, the world's most popular digital currency, has been on a roll - but no one is really sure why. After dipping well below $200 in January, bitcoin trading at more than $410 Tuesday afternoon before cutting some of those gains, according to the CoinDesk Bitcoin Price Index. That's ...

item.title: How '70s Cryptography Could Improve Bitcoin in 2016 and Beyond - CoinDesk
item.description:
How '70s Cryptography Could Improve Bitcoin in 2016 and Beyond - CoinDesk

Kristov Atlas is a network security and privacy researcher who studies cryptocurrencies. He is currently a security engineer for Blockchain and co-founder of the Open Bitcoin Privacy Project. He is the author of "Anonymous Bitcoin: How to Keep Your Éƒ All to Yourself", a practical guide to maximizing financial privacy.

item.title: 4 Trends That Will Shape Bitcoin Regulation in 2016 - CoinDesk
item.description:
4 Trends That Will Shape Bitcoin Regulation in 2016 - CoinDesk

Jason Weinstein and Alan Cohn are attorneys at Steptoe & Johnson LLP in Washington DC, and counsels to the Blockchain Alliance. Jason previously served as deputy assistant attorney general at the Department of Justice and serves on the advisory boards of BitFury, the Chamber of Digital Commerce and Coin Center.

item.title: This Might Be Satoshi Nakamoto on Mainstream Media
item.description:
This Might Be Satoshi Nakamoto on Mainstream Media

Dave Kleiman made a name for himself as a computer forensics expert before being claimed as co-inventor of Bitcoin by Craig Wright, the Australian recently verified by Gavin Andresen and Jon Matonis as Satoshi Nakamoto. The veteran Kleiman, if he were co-inventor of bitcoin, never used the fortune that would be his.

item.title: Bitcoin has been on an explosive rally, and is back through $US500
item.description:
Bitcoin has been on an explosive rally, and is back through $US500

Bitcoin is back. The cryptocurrency has been surging in US dollar terms over recent weeks, surging back through the $US500 mark, up around 170% from its lows of January last year. And in the past few weeks it has exploded by $US100 from the price on May 19th.

item.title: Commonwealth Bank of Australia: Bitcoin is Overstated
item.description:
Commonwealth Bank of Australia: Bitcoin is Overstated

The CEO of Commonwealth Bank of Australia recently spoke about the importance of innovation in the banking industry and how Bitcoin technology may grow to disrupt the industry in the future. The evolution of Bitcoin technology from being just a ledger to the next big innovation in the fintech sector has waken up the finance giants.
